 Satan never made anyone do anything that they didn't choose to do.
 
 My advice is to let that zeal that you display here go into knowledge. At your age you a very impressionable, so use this advice wisely. DO NOT readily conform to religion. Let God do the teaching. How? By studying and praying as much as you can. Be quiet and let the Spirit of God talk to your spirit-man. Right now you’ve got milk, but it won’t last and it won’t be enough. Prepare yourself for the meatier things. Find out where your strength comes from and why. Don’t rush to judgment – even if evil seems so evident. Right now you’re under the wing of God; He’s nurturing you, but don’t peek out from under hurling accusations and making threats. Slow down and learn, gain every bit of information you can about your enemy and how it works. You might be surprised sometimes just who your enemy is.
 
 Above all – never doubt God’s ability, even when things look like they're all but lost. It’s not your place to take on the whole army of darkness, not yet, but your time will come. Gain as much knowledge as you can. Then, when you get older, that is what will separate you from others – not your words.

 It is certainly within the realm of possibilities that Jesus never existed as a physical human being on this earth. The objective evidence that can be gathered suggests that it is unlikely a Jesus figure actually did walk the earth as the Bible says he did. 
 
 However, with the underlying assumption that he did walk this earth and die for the 'sins of humanity,' many people have claimed that they have come to know this Jesus personally. (Of course, we know this is not possible in the literal sense of one physical human being interacting with another physical human being.) Though many individuals throughout the world have experienced something to lead them to believe that Jesus really was present on this earth about 2,000 years ago, these experiences are necessarily subjective -- as they have been perceived only through interpretation of objective events, or through a personal experience perceived only in the mind of the individual. The fact that many people around the world believe that Jesus literally walked on this earth is often claimed as evidence for the physical existence of Jesus in our actual history on earth. However, this is a logical fallacy.
 
 It is possible that Jesus existed as described in the bible. It is also possible that he didn't. I accept whatever is.

 The only problem here lies in the assumption that the Bible is a factual document, which is hardly acceptable as when questioning the existence of JC, one is by extension questioning the validity of the bible. You cannot therefore quote as proof that JC existed the fact that the Bible says so. Hence your web site, though I haven\'t read the whole lot, appears to be just working out an approximate date for JC\'s birth based on what information is available in the Bible. This is most defiantly not akin to proving his existence.
